The 8th International Workshop on
Artificial Intelligence and Statistics

[edit]

January 3 - 6, 2001
Key West, Florida, USA

The 8th International Workshop on Artificial Intelligence and Statistics (Artificial Intelligence and Statistics 2001) will be held in Key West, Florida, USA from Wednesday, 3 January 2001 to Saturday, 6 January 2001 at the The Hyatt Hotel.

Since its inception in 1985, AISTATS has been an interdisciplinary gathering of researchers at the intersection of artificial intelligence, machine learning, statistics, and related areas.

The Proceedings of Artificial Intelligence and Statistics 2001 are now available.

  • Tutorials (January 4)

    David Edwards (Novo Pharmaceutical Company)
    "Graphical models for mixed data : an introduction to the theory and practice"

    Yoav Freund    (AT&T Research)
    "Predicting More -- Assuming Less, new methodologies in statistical inference"

    David MacKay  (University of Cambridge)
    "Error correcting codes and belief propagation"

  • Main program (January 5-7)
  • On-line repository of workshop papers

  • Hotel information/reservations.  The workshop participants will receive a substantially reduced rate.

    • Information for authors (final papers were due November 10)
